comments.commentBody:
.
Elke, you impish subject of Her Majesty!

FYI -- just found out this weekend that the woman who has done live play-by-play announcing for the annual crosswords tourney south of our Border is of Canadian descent!

and Elke
MTF T- "south of our border"- is that Mexico ? How far did she descend?
Am hitting my knitting- it's safer.
Good Night.

.
Elke --

"OUR Border" = the world's longest undefended border

i.e. the Canadian-US border

and Elke
Just an itty bitty contribution: IT COUPLES often are the grist for juicy titbits (Brit. sp.) in SWIMSUIT EDITIONS.
I hope I won't be RAIDed.

If Krugman had a relationship with Goldman Sachs, I would not begrudge him that for a moment; I'd rather he have the money and not them. But let's see if conflict of interest gets due recognition and attention in the election; what we aspire to is still democracy after all; we sneer superiorly at corruption in Mexico and meanwhile back at home.  I hope Krugman is not shy on the subject of conflict of interest.

I sincerely appreciate your comments. FYI, the summer program was run solely by the university and a university dean was in charge. This happened immediately after the racial tension started to flare up in July 2014. I haven't written off my alma mater, not at all, but I'm terribly disappointed in the school's response. At Stanford, for example, there is a zero tolerance position that encompasses all university and independent summer programs. Clout and money shouldn't forgive horrible, racist behavior but unfortunately, it does.

.
Elke, you impish subject of Her Majesty!

FYI -- just found out this weekend that the woman who has done live play-by-play announcing for the annual crosswords tourney south of our Border is of Canadian descent!
So?

You may be the only one who was Iseulted. OTOH, I had only just learned of this line, and was tickled to be reminded of "It isn't pronounced YEeTS".

Sale on bistro sandwiches: Discount of Monte Cristo.

We've made this for decades.  Some unneeded ingredients here.  Seeds only sour cream, clams, liquor and granulated garlic or garlic salt. Keep it simple.  Yes, some fridge time helps to blend the flavors.  Cayenne pepper is such a personal thing...
Must also add:  Use a lot more clams!

and Elke
MTF T- "south of our border"- is that Mexico ? How far did she descend?
Am hitting my knitting- it's safer.
Good Night.
It's an 1/8-tsp of *ground* cloves, not whole. It's the caraway seeds that are to be left whole.
After you remove the garlic from those two tablespoons of oil, you then cook the stems and leaves of chard in those same two tablespoons......
Six TABLEspoons of olive oil?  This seems like a typo - using two full tablespoons to cook two cloves of garlic, for example, seems totally off.  Can we confirm?

Assuming it is food-grade peppermint oil, you would need to use dramatically less. Peppermint extract is the oil mixed into solution, so it is substantially diluted. A couple of drops would be enough. Ingested directly, peppermint oil can be toxic and should be kept away from children.

The base here is essentially a pastry. If you have a manual pastry blender, that would be fine. You could also cut the butter into small cubes and work them into the flour by hand, squishing them between your fingers to make a coarse meal. This is what Julia Child described in Mastering the Art of French Cooking and it still works great - no tools needed!

Made this last night w/ a friend. It was delicious, but rich, rich, rich. Took us nearly 3 hours including baking time. Part of that was rolling out fresh pasta, but that part well worth it. Next time I'll cut back on the oil, reduce # of shallots, go for the most assertive-tasting mushrooms possible, and will start earlier....
An Asian friend added a balsamic vinegar which ramped the sauce up a notch but still kept it classic.

I make this sort of thing often.  While they DO freeze OK, the texture is far better if cooked fresh.  In addition to the listed ground meats, I often use fish and shellfish in the filling.  In all cases the meat/fish etc. gets a good whiz in the food processor before mixing with veggies and 'shroom bits.  Use what you have!  I was hoping for a more interesting dipping sauce, but no joy.  At the very least, consider adding some sesame oil; it contributes a lot of flavor.

Arun,
Steinem has understood what she said and is embarrassed. Dr Krugman is more than entitled to his opinion. What Secretary Albright and President Clinton was much worse than inappropriate it potentially alienated voters that Democrats sorely need in November.
Today Secretary Clinton must make the kind of decision that must be made by the occupant of the oval office she must dismiss Bill Clinton and Madeline Albright from her campaign. Should Hillary Clinton fire her friend and her husband she will have taken a giant step in proving herself worthy of the Presidency if she fails to remove them from her campaign and she must await a possible second opportunity to prove her decision making abilities.

If she doesn't remove them from her campaign, then her decision making ability is proven by that fact alone. Why keep giving her chances to prove she's better than that, if she won't take the ones she has already been given?

> Are they any better than Cruz, Rubio, Carson, Trump, Fiorina, Christie, Kasich?

Until the general election that's entirely beside the point. The primary is about nominating the best candidate for president.

> The only thing worth anything is basic decency.

Amen to that.

Albright, Steinem, Clinton (Bill), Krugman - full frontal assault on anyone who stands in Hillary's way. Are they any better than Cruz, Rubio, Carson, Trump, Fiorina, Christie, Kasich? Who knows? After all, everything they do is in a good cause; and the ends always justify the means, don't they?

Be fearful, that is what all of them say. Of Supreme Court justices, of immigrants, of history, of Obamacare, of war, of moochers. Join your fear with mine, and I will preserve what we have or make us great again. The other side is coming to get us and will impose great misery on us unless we make sure we win. Anybody not with the program is a traitor. "In God We Trust" and "Fear is our God" - pay obeisance to Him, and He may grant you a Reprieve.

The only thing worth anything is basic decency. You are told every day that to have it, you must give it up. Else, history or something.

Was Richard Nixon all that bad after all in comparison with latest Republicans?  I would say NO except for Cambodia about which most Americans did not have much interest. So the risk is much higher. But Bernie's chance may be higher by the same token.

So, finally, we know, who is REALLY running against Bernie. And it's not Hillary:

"Bill Clinton, After Months of Restraint, Unleashes Stinging Attack on Bernie Sanders"

"http://mobile.nytimes.com/2016/02/08/us/politics/bill-clinton-after-mont..."

What is commonly referred to as the capital gains tax applies only to so-called long-term capital gains, i.e., gains on assets held for at least a year. The tax on short-term capital gains, i.e., assets held for less than a year, is the same as ordinary income tax. The long-term capital gains tax rate is a ceiling, not a flat rate. If a person's income is modest, he or she may already pay little to no taxes on his or her capital gains. Unlike real losses on other assets, for example, a home, capital gains can be offset by capital losses for tax purposes.

Considering that investing in the stock market is about the only way to effectively generate a high enough return on savings to fund one's retirement, the question is why more Americans don't do it.

Hi Patty,
Let us all follow Peyton and Big John E's example and be gracious winners, OK?
Happy in Orange tonight!
The NY Times sports writers should be ashamed! They showed their lack of knowledge of football and just went with the headlines and no depth. Shame on you!

The Republican candidates, in particular Rubio, Cruz, and Christie, speak in hurried, pinched, and elevated tones of voice every time they open their mouths. Fast-talking snake oil salesmen.

No semblance of measured discourse comes from any of them. Every issue is over-simplified, treated as a dire emergency, and addressed with nervous, grandiose recitations of ideological boilerplate which itself boils down to simple-minded over exaggeration.

None of these men deliver anything beyond shrill hucksterism, intellectually weak personalities satisfying their own personal ambitions by inflicting themselves on the American public in this contest. Fast-talking smoke is designed to cover the embarrassing shallowness of their beliefs, and it doesn't work.
Maybe it was a fairy tale for the Broncos. This reader could hardly stay awake. What a crashing bore! Too bad Helen Mirren wasn't on the field - she would have known how to kick some a..
The Puppy Bowl had better offense.

Agreed. The sports writers, sometimes all year long, get it wrong -- I think they actually stop paying attention except for the pivotal games -- and then exclaim in 38 pt font that it was an extraordinary upset. Gosh!

The same incompetence on the writers' part was evident when Denver beat the Packers in the Superbowl back in the late 1990s. It wasn't the huge upset that the writers made it out to be; they simply had to divert attention from how wrong they had been for most of the football season.
Three star quarterbacks, don't forget what they did to Rothlesberger.

The headline should be Broncos stun media, including NYT who were all calling for comfortable win for the Panthers. Seemed like nobody saw the AFCCG where NE/Brady took a beating. And no that game was not even close to being a 20-18. There should have been a few fumbles but Brady was just about getting it out.

Tonight's game, Cam/Carolina wasn't that lucky. Fumbles, interceptions, and there you have it, complete beat downs two games a row for 2 star quarterbacks.

Again, good defense beats good offense. And it made good offense look pretty lame doing so. For a long period, the fumble recovery in the end-zone made a close game look much less so, but Carolina never seemed to have the confidence that could have elevated their game.

You need to be confident to be calm enough to see the open man anywhere on the field, even while the defense is bearing down fast.

Joe (Cool) Montana could do that. If the 9ers needed it, in a big game, even a fan like me would be confident that Montana could get two touchdowns in the last two minutes. And you know why? Because the 9ers also had a fantastic defense that could give him the ball back 3 downs and punt.

Congratulations, Peyton. Retire at the top!
Cold Play was awful. Bruno and Beyonce were fun and exciting to watch. Lady Gaga was nothing short of great.

comments.userLocation: Facebook Drive i@ 1 Hacker Way in Menlo Park
comments.commentBody: Apart from the game, which was fun & surprising to watch, I congratulate all the people who helped make the half-time program so exceptional! I was pleasantly  shocked by looking at all the fans in the stadium who had certain colored lights shining on them during the half time program as depicted in pic 5 on this web page. I also thought Lady Gaga did an excellent job singing and it was refreshing to hear her sing more conventional.
